TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit GCMemoryInfo extends System.ValueType

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property FragmentedBytes As Long
public: property long FragmentedBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total fragmentation when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: An integer representing the total fragmentation when the last garbage collection occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
Let's take the example below: | OBJ_A | OBJ_B | OBJ_C | OBJ_D | OBJ_E |
Let's say OBJ_B, OBJ_C and and OBJ_E are garbage and get collected, but the heap does not get compacted. The resulting heap will look like the following:
| OBJ_A | F | OBJ_D |
The memory between OBJ_A and OBJ_D marked `F` is considered part of the `FragmentedBytes`, and will be used to allocate new objects.
The memory after OBJ_D will not be considered part of the `FragmentedBytes`, and will also be used to allocate new objects.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HeapSizeBytes As Long
public: property long HeapSizeBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total heap size when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: An integer representing the total heap size when the last garbage collection occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property HighMemoryLoadThresholdBytes As Long
public: property long HighMemoryLoadThresholdBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the high memory load threshold when the last garbage collection occured.
Docs.value: An integer representing the high memory load threshold when the last garbage collection occured.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property MemoryLoadBytes As Long
public: property long MemoryLoadBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the memory load when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: An integer representing the memory load when the last garbage collection occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property TotalAvailableMemoryBytes As Long
public: property long TotalAvailableMemoryBytes { long get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the total available memory for the garbage collector to use when the last garbage collection occurred.
Docs.value: An integer representing the total available memory for the garbage collector to use when the last garbage collection occurred.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
If the environment variable `COMPlus_GCHeapHardLimit` is set, or `Server.GC.HeapHardLimit` is in `runtimeconfig.json`, this will come from that.
If the program is run in a container, this will be an implementation-defined fraction of the container's size.
Otherwise, this is the physical memory on the machine that was available for the garbage collector to use when the last garbage collection occurred.
